PLEASANTON -- After nearly two years of lobbying, an Oakland-based animal welfare group will again argue for a ban on wild animal acts at the Alameda County Fair.
A meeting -- hosted by the Fair Liaison Committee of the Alameda County Board of Supervisors -- will be held Tuesday in a small conference room in Oakland with room for only about 30 people.
Eric Mills of Action for Animals said his group purchased two half-page newspaper ads to publicize the meeting.
The ads, which were published in today's Tri-Valley Herald and the Oakland Tribune, cost$1,200, Mills said.
